author: Jessica Bennett
title: Twitter Erupts Over Donald Trump’s Response to Congressional Black Caucus Question
text:
Jessica Bennett   
Donald Trump held a news conference Thursday to announce his latest pick to lead the Department of Labor after original choice, Andrew Puzder, withdrew himself from consideration. 
While the announcement of Alexander Acosta’s appointment got lost in the shuffle, viewers had plenty more to gasp about, including one gaffe where the President asked a black reporter if she was “friends” with the Congressional Black Caucus. 

During the Q&A portion of the conference — his first solo conference since taking office — April Ryan, White House correspondent for the American Urban Radio Networks, asked the President if he planned to include the Congressional Black Caucus in discussions about his plan to revitalize inner cities. 
"I would," he responded. "I'll tell you what, do you want to set up the meeting? Are they friends of yours?" 
Trump just asked a black journalist if she was "friends" with the Congressional Black Caucus and wanted to set up a mtg for him w/ the CBC. pic.twitter.com/whnDJLI8MI — Kyle Griffin (@kylegriffin1) February 16, 2017 
Taken aback by the implication, April responded, "No, no, no, no — I'm just a reporter." 



Twitter erupted in both anger and shame as they lambasted the prez for not knowing what the CBC is, assuming all black people know each other, and treating a White House correspondent like his personal secretary. 

Check out Twitter’s best responses to the foolishness below. 
Hey @realDonaldTrump : @AprilDRyan is a honest & professional reporter. She's not your secretary. @Reince knows @RepRichmond 's number. Use it — Gwen Moore (@RepGwenMoore) February 16, 2017 . @realDonaldTrump : @AprilDRyan is a journalist. Want to set up a meeting w/ @OfficialCBC ? Show some leadership & call @RepRichmond yourself. — Gwen Moore (@RepGwenMoore) February 16, 2017 Trump called himself the least racist person then assumed a random black reporter could set up a meeting with the Congressional Black Caucus — Mike Tunison (@xmasape) February 16, 2017 Did he just say to @AprilDRyan "your people"? #trumpnewsconference
